results.description: Our Pilsner is golden and crystal clear. The hops add a pleasant bitterness and a lemony, peppery taste.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, Caravienne, Carapils malt
results.name: Pilsner

results.description: Brewed in collaboration with our friends at The Royale, this stout is sweet and lucious with subtle notes of fresh vanilla bean.
results.name: Vanilla Milk Stout

results.description: Our Schwarzbier, or black beer, is a traditional German black lager. Do not let its dark color fool you, this beer is smooth and malty.
results.hops: Polish Marynka, Hallertauer Mittelfrueh, Tettnang Tettnanger
results.malts: Pale Malt, EuroPils Malt, Munich Malt, Dark Chocolate Malt
results.name: Schwarzbier

results.description: Our Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Stout is complex and strong, with coffee and chocolate flavors.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, Caravienne, roasted barley, black malt, chocolate malt, caramel malt, flaked oats, biscuit malt
results.name: Bourbon Barrel-Aged Imperial Stout
results.process: Aged in Bourbon barrels for several months after primary fermentation and conditioning

results.description: Our Dry Hopped American Pale Ale (APA) is charged with American hops to create a bold, aromatic ale.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley
results.name: Dry Hopped APA
results.process: Dry hopped with whole cone American hops; unfiltered

results.description: So our newest beer historically hails from the city of Vienna but has strong ties to Mexico as well.  There was an influx of immigrant brewers to Mexico in the 19th century and Vienna Lager was a fave of Maximilian I during his wing-ding there according to all things internet. This lager style is very robust in flavor as a result of its namesake malt (vienna) which is roughly the color of Pale malt.  These beers are typically decoction mashed which is a time honored method for lager brewing in Germany but we have an infusion mash tun, so guess what?  I think our mash tun did a pretty good job.  Copper colored, Hallertau hopped, clean, bready, nutty, and 4.4%.  Thank the city of Vienna next time you're there.
results.name: Vienna

results.description: We start with a Belgian-Style Witbier, add 300lbs of strawberries, 100lbs of rhubarb stalks, and a few handfuls of Indian coriander. The result is a subtly sweet, refereshingly tart, suprisingly citrusy tribute to summer.
results.name: Strawberry Rhubarb Tart

results.description: Pale ales are ubiquitous and are probably the single most important style of beer to have introduced the concept of 'craft'.  Pales are a fairly quick beer to brew- many examples are ready in a couple of weeks- and appeal mainly in that they are quite often balanced beers without too many distractions and without too fine a point on it- they taste like beer!  Our Pale Ale is loaded with Rye malt (about 20%) which adds some viscosity, richness, and a slightly spicy finish.  We use a fair bit of caramel malt for color and our American hop charge has a slight bite and piney finish.  All this said, I think our Pale shares a few finer points with its sister style - Amber.  Our 'Pale' is pretty dark and has a pronounced richness from caramel malt.
results.malts: Rye, caramel malts
results.name: Rye Pale Ale

results.description: Our Hefeweizen is a light, unfiltered wheat beer, often served with a wedge of lemon.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, malted wheat, Munich malt
results.name: Hefeweizen

results.description: This is the traditional German lager for Springtime fasting. A big beer with a deep brown color and a rich, malty flavor.
results.name: Doppelbock

results.description: This unique brew has the color of a brown ale, but the aroma of an American style IPA. Dry-hopped with Simcoe, Amarillo and Ahtanum, this beer will prove just how complex a brown ale can be.
results.name: India Brown Ale

results.description: Dark chocolate orange stout is an added twist to the chocolate stout where orange peels were used and aging on roasted cocoa nibs was twice as long to give a more deep chocolate character with a nice citrus twist in the flavor.
results.name: Dark Chocolate Orange Stout

results.description: A robust Porter with orange peel and coriander for a fruity, roasty flavor.
results.name: Spiced Porter

results.description: Our Export IPA (India Pale Ale) is a strong, heavily-hopped, British-style ale. This beer features a big malt backbone of 2-row and caramel malted barley.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley, biscuit malt
results.name: Export IPA
results.process: Classic English-style Export IPA; dry hopped

results.description: Eighty Shilling is a slightly-sweet, mildly-hopped, gently-carbonated, amber Scottish-style ale, lower in alcohol than strong Scotch Ales.

In the hop capital of Belgium, Hommel is the word for humulus, the plant genus where hops reside. Our Hommel Bier defies tradition by combining North American malts, Pacific Northwest hops, and a Belgian yeast strain. The result is a beer that combines earthy and spicy tones from the yeast with a slight orange note contributed by the hops. We think it's buzzworthy.
results.name: Hommel Bier

results.description: A mild-mannered brown ale, medium-bodied with a rich malty character and a good dose of American hops.
results.name: American Brown Ale

results.description: Our Helles-Style Summer Lager is a bright, golden beer, perfect for summertime.
results.malts: 2-row and Europils malted barley, Carapils malt
results.name: Summer Lager

results.description: 1992-1997 - Available late April
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, wheat malt, unmalted wheat, Munich malt, Carapils
results.name: No. 20 - Volume 2: Hop Toddy
results.process: Dry hopped; aged in Bourbon barrels

results.description: A dry hopped, straw-colored American wheat ale, brewed with fresh lemongrass, lemon zest and Kafir lime leaves.
results.name: Spiced Golden Ale

results.description: Available exclusively at The Wine and Cheese Place. Loaded with oak and bourbon character, as well as the rich dried-fruit character of the Quadrupel.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, malted wheat, Munich malt, Special B malt, Caravienne, Dark Candi sugar
results.name: Bourbon Barrel Aged Quadrupel
results.process: Strong Belgian-style Ale; aged in a Buffalo Trace Bourbon Barrel for several months

results.description: The original beer from our breweryÉa smooth golden ale with three types of barley, two varieties of hops and fresh Kolsch yeast. ItÕs cold-conditioned and carefully filtered for a clear, beautifully colored, delicious beer.
results.malts: Pilsner, Munich 10L, Caramel 40L
results.name: O'Fallon Gold

results.description: Ok.  This is one we took some liberties on.  Firstly, most Scotch Ale is decidedly malt driven with very little hop note.  Our version is much hoppier.  We use Cascade to add delicate hop fragrance over the top of the beer and the middle palette.  Secondly, we don't utilize a long boil to coax out rich melanoidin flavors or burnt caramel notes as many Scotch Ale producers do.  Our Malt Bill includes a traditionally used malt - Golden Promise- and a few specialty malts to get us where we want to go.  Think of it as a contemporary look at one of the most steadfast styles.
results.malts: Golden Promise
results.name: Scottish Ale

results.description: Our Porter is a dark ale with a mild roasted character and a distinct sweetness from caramel malt.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, caramel malt, chocolate malt
results.name: Porter

results.description: Our Oatmeal Stout is a classic British-style stout brewed with flaked oatmeal and roasted barley.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley, roasted barley, oat flakes
results.name: Oatmeal Stout

results.description: Our Grand Cru is a rich, golden color with fruity and spicy alcohol flavors, supported by a soft malt character.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, wheat malt, unmalted wheat, aromatic malt, sugar
results.name: Grand Cru
results.process: Spiced with orange peel and coriander

results.description: Guess where the Munich Dunkel is from?!  Yep.  Pittsburgh.  I joke I joke.  Munich Dunkel was developed in the city of Munich as a response to their moderately carbonate water.  Its a really simple beer with stunning results (I'm speaking stylistically, though ours is pretty darn good).  Primarily Munich Malt (a slightly darker than Pale type) does the heavy lifting and Hallertau hops give a very soft Hop lift to the brew.  Aromas of Cereals, Breads, Malt (well, thats obvious but true) and lighter notes of chocolates, nuts, and caramels can be present.  Melanoidins flavors are apparent and show up most in versions that are decoction mashed.  Melanoidins are formed when sugars and amino acids combine through heat and water and give a very rich and emphatic Malt aroma.
results.name: Munich Dunkel

results.description: Originally brewed for our friends at Pi, this amber ale is fermented with lager yeast, delightfully crisp, and pleasantly hoppy.
results.name: Common

results.description: 2007-2011 - Available December 26, 2011
results.malts: 2-row malted barley
results.name: No. 20 - Volume 4: Southern Hemispher IPA

results.description: 1991 - This recipe was created by our original brewing team, in tribute to our commitment to classic beer styles.
results.malts: Pilsner malt, Carapils malt
results.name: No. 20 - Volume 1: Imperial Pilsner

results.description: Our Black IPA is brewed with Briess' midnight wheat to give all the color of a stout without the roast, instead the flavor comes from the 3 pounds per barrel of dry hopping with some of the most aromatic hops America has to offer.﻿
results.name: Black IPA

results.description: Available exclusively at select Schnucks Markets. Our Raspberry Coffee Stout is brewed with raspberry puree and Kaldi's coffee to create the perfect dessert beer.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley, roasted barley, oat flakes
results.name: Raspberry Coffee Stout
results.process: Real raspberries during fermentation, Kaldi's Columbia Monserrate coffee added with cold toddy method

results.description: A smooth, creamy, slightly roasty well-balanced dark ale. Its mild-mannered persona entices even the most timid into the realm of dark beers.
results.name: Robust Porter

results.description: Deep amber in color and medium in body, this malty lager is a milder version of the Oktoberfest style.
results.name: Vienna Lager

results.description: This strong lager, also known as Export, is straw colored and well balanced; neither hops nor malt predominates.
results.name: Dortmunder

results.description: Unfiltered wheat ale brewed with a unique Belgian yeast and flavored with orange peel and coriander. Very snappy and refreshing! One-third of the grist is unmalted wheat from Alhambra, Illinois.
results.name: Witbier

results.description: Our Bavarian-style Weissbier is an authentic German-style unfiltered wheat beer, full of clove and banana characters.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, wheat malt, Munich malt, flaked wheat
results.name: Bavarian-Style Weissbier

results.description: Our Tripel is golden with a relatively light body compared to its alcohol content.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, Carapils malt, sugar
results.name: Tripel

results.description: Our Raspberry Hefeweizen is a true fruit beer, not a fruit-flavored beer. We add pureed raspberries to our Hefeweizen during the primary fermentation process.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, malted wheat, Munich malt
results.name: Raspberry Hefeweizen
results.process: Unfiltered; flavored with whole fruit raspberry puree

results.description: Our Bière de Garde is a traditional French farmhouse ale, with burnt-orange coloring.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, Munich malt, Caravienne, biscuit malt
results.name: Bière de Garde
results.process: Traditional French farmhouse-style artisanal ale; bottle-conditioned

results.description: a.k.a. ~Schwarzbier~ is flowing through the taps.  As we pour you a beer you'll notice that this Lager is pretty darn dark- not quite black, but getting there.  The next thing you'll notice is a subtle off-white cap of foam and a discreet, fragrant roast aroma.  Hopefully the next thing you notice is that you are drinking and enjoying it.  Black Lagers are in a pretty narrow category and while ours does have an apparent edge from roasted malt, the relaxed and clean nature of the Pils Malt base really makes this beer a solid drinker.  Hops are from Hallertau again and ABV clocks in at 4.4 so you don't have to clock out.
results.malts: Pilsner Malt
results.name: Black Lager

results.description: Our Oak Aged Barleywine has a deep copper color with intense malt flavors and assertive hops for balance.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, Munich malt, caramel malt, roasted barley
results.name: Oak-Aged Barleywine
results.process: Aged on new Missouri oak chips for several months after primary fermentation and conditioning

results.description: Light amber in color, this medium-bodied ale is highly hopped with English hops in both aroma and bitterness, with the maltiness still quite apparent.
results.name: English IPA

results.description: Our Quadrupel is a mahogany-colored ale with a rich sweetness, light spiciness and high alcohol content.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, malted wheat, Munich malt, Special B malt, Caravienne, Dark Candi sugar
results.name: Quadrupel

results.description: Like pumpkin pie in a bottle...we add 136 pounds of real pumpkin to the three-barley mash and then season the fi nished beer with cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves. Available September 1.
results.malts: Pale, White Wheat, Caramel 90L
results.name: O'Fallon Pumpkin Beer

results.description: An ale version of the lager style, our Cream Ale is a flavorful, lighter beer brewed with 17% flaked maize. Cold-conditioning creates a clean, crisp beer.
results.name: Cream Ale

results.description: Our flagship Pale Ale is a smooth, balanced, copper-colored session beer with mildly spiced flavor and aroma from the East Kent Goldings hops.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley
results.name: Pale Ale

results.description: Our Scotch Ale is a traditional Scottish ale and pours a dark mahogany color, with the aroma of sweet caramel and a lightly bitter finish.
results.name: Scotch Ale

results.description: We dry-hop this American Style India Pale Ale with seven grains and four domestic hop varieties by adding dry whole hops to the finishing tank so the beer rests "on top" of the hops for five extra days!Malty sweetness up front with big cascade and glacier hops in the finish -- a wonderfully drinkable IPA!
results.malts: Summit, Cascade, Pale, White Wheat, Caramel 20L, Caramel 40L, Carapils, Victory, Bonlander
results.name: O'Fallon 5-Day IPA

results.description: Black Ale isn't really a style of beer, but rather a subjective name given to many beers when they really don't fit inside the realm of other dark beers like Porter and Stout.  Our Black ale was developed with a particular hop in mind - Sorachi Ace - and was brewed for Schlafly's Fresh Hop Festival this year.  We used a lot of dark roasted malts to balance the intensity of the Sorachi Hops and played to the hops strength as a first addition bittering hop.  The end result is a rich, slightly creamy ale that has notes of citrus underneath layers of roasted aromas.
results.name: Black Ale

results.description: A traditional strong English ale brewed with brown sugar and molasses, this malty ale is a cross between a Scotch Ale and an English Barleywine.
results.name: Old Ale

results.description: Our "Best" is in the same style sub-category as our "Bitter" but takes a slightly different track.  Its malt bill shows more copper in color, and the caramel malts add a depth of maltiness that plays to the strength of our ESB type yeast which leaves the beer tasting full despite its very modest 4% alcohol.  It is traditionally hopped with English Hops, Fuggle and East Kent Goldings which offer a herbal, woodsy, and grassy aromas.  Our "Best" is a good example of a 'session' beer which is any type of beer that restrains its ABV and allows the drinker to enjoy a few brews in good company.
results.name: British Best

results.description: Our American IPA has big, bold hop flavor from American-grown hops and is golden colored and full bodied.
results.malts: 2-row and Crystal malted barley
results.name: American IPA
results.process: New World American IPA; dry hopped

results.description: Brewed to honor the 50th anniversary celebration of St. Louis’s sister city relationship with Stuttgart, Germany, this dry-hopped Märzen is an American interpretation of a classic German beer style. Dry-hopped with Hallertauer Mittelfrüh.
results.name: Trocken Hopfen Märzen

results.description: A nice, light straw-colored Belgian style beer brewed to grow up enough yeast for our Belgian Quadrupel.
results.name: Belgian Singel

results.description: Our look at British Pale Ale is a bit more opportunistic but still within the "Special/Best/Premium" style.  We wanted a nice bright session beer with the Bitter concept (medium Gold, good clarity, low maltiness, dry finish, bitterness) and came up with one that incorporates North American Hops- Centennial- that keep the beer punchy.  This is a newish trend within the style and one that we feel keeps the flavor bright and refreshing.)
results.name: British Bitter

results.description: Imagine our smooth, clean wheat beer with a touch of peach and you get the idea behind O'Fallon Wheach, our peach wheat beer.  Light,  refreshing and crisp, it's perfect for any occasion!
results.malts: Pilsner, White Wheat, Bonlander Hops
results.name: O'Fallon Wheach

results.description: An amber-colored, full-bodied, malty lager beer. The malt comes through in the aroma and flavor, while the hop bitterness balances out the sweetness from the malt.
results.name: Bock

results.description: Sour Mash Belgian Dark Ale with Black Currants (Brewed in Collaboration with Half Acre)
results.name: Plan B

results.description: This medium-bodied, dark, hoppy ale is THE beer of Düsseldorf. Well balanced and mild-mannered, this beer is great for autumn.
results.name: Altbier

results.description: Chocolate stout is a robust stout using caramel and roasted grains as well as roasted cocoa nibs. This sweet stout is rife with roast and chocolate aromas with a very smooth body.
results.name: Chocolate Stout

results.description: Our Christmas Ale is brewed to encompass the tastes of the holiday season.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley, Munich malt, chocolate malt, honey
results.name: Christmas Ale
results.process: Spiced with orange peel, juniper berries, ginger root, cardamom and cloves

results.description: Medium body and effervescence contribute to a light, dry impression, despite this Belgian beer’s strength and sweet, smooth finish.
results.name: Belgian Dubbel

results.description: Our Coffee Stout is a classic combination of a traditional stout and premium French roast coffee from St. Louis roaster, Kaldi’s Coffee.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley, roasted barley, oat flakes
results.name: Coffee Stout
results.process: Blend of Kaldi's coffee and Schlafly stout using a cold extraction toddy

results.description: Our Pumpkin Ale has a bold, big pumpkin taste, flavored with Pumpkin squash, nutmeg, cloves and cinnamon.
results.malts: 2-row and Crystal malted barley, Munich malt, wheat malt, chocolate malt
results.name: Pumpkin Ale
results.process: Brewed with pumpkin squash and a blend of spices

results.description: Our Irish-Style Extra Stout pours black and is an amped-up version of a traditional dry stout.
results.malts: 2-row and Crystal malted barley, roasted barley
results.name: Irish-Style Extra Stout

results.description: This beer is made with Guittard roasted cocoa nibs and purée of strawberries. While a chocolate covered strawberry is far more decadent, it served as the flavor inspiration for this beer. The strawberries, once fermented, leave behind a tartness.
results.name: Strawberry Cocoa Porter

results.description: This big, golden, malty lager is full-bodied, sweet and delicious! Brewed for the Maifest, in celebration of spring.
results.name: Maibock

results.description: 1998-2006 - Available August 2011
results.malts: Euro-Pils, White Wheat, Torrified Wheat
results.name: No. 20 - Volume 3: Citrus Witbier
results.process: Belgian unfiltered, Flavored with coriander and orange, lemon and grapefruit peel

results.description: Available exclusively at select Schnucks Markets. Our Holiday Ale is a rich, amber-colored beer brewed specifically for the holiday season.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, Munich malt, flaked wheat, Special B, molasses
results.name: Holiday Ale

results.description: Available exclusively at Whole Foods Markets. Brewed from the finest quality raw materials including 2-row malted barley, rye, and German noble hops, this beer is as malty a German-style lager as you can find.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, munich malt, carapils malt, caramel malt, chocolate malt, flaked rye
results.name: Rye Bock
results.process: A variation on a traditional German Bock, all ingredients are Certified Organic except for the Flaked Rye

results.description: The mild character of this porter, with its rich, roasty overtones, blends well with the subtle, smooth flavor of the smoked malt.
results.name: Smoked Porter

results.description: Our Oktoberfest is a traditional Bavarian Märzen with a toasty malt aroma and slight caramel taste.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley, Munich malt, aromatic malt
results.name: Oktoberfest

results.description: A dark wheat beer that tastes like a chocolate covered cherry…only better! Available November 1.
results.malts: Pale, White Wheat, Caramel 40L, Chocolate
results.name: O'Fallon Cherry Chocolate Beer

results.description: Our Winter ESB (Extra Special Bitter) may have the word “bitter” in its name, but the key to this style is balance.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley, Munich malt, rye malt
results.name: Winter ESB

results.description: Available exclusively at select Schnucks Markets. This bold, unfiltered wheat beer is loaded with fruity and spicy characters.
results.malts: 2-row and caramel malted barley, Munich malt, white wheat, Midnight wheat, Special B
results.name: Weizenbock

results.description: This light-bodied, dry stout has the bitterness of roasted barley with flaked barley added for a smooth finish.
results.name: Nitro Irish Stout

results.description: Our Kölsch is a classic golden ale that uses a centuries old yeast strain sourced from a famous Kölsch brewer in Köln, Germany.
results.malts: 2-row malted barley, wheat malt, Munich malt, Carapils malt
results.name: Kölsch

results.description: This brew looks at weisbier and doesn't really stray from the classic themes.  Moderate Phenols (clove), low noble hop aroma (Hallertau), slightly sweet flavors from Pilsner Malt, some haziness thrown from the proteins in the wheat malt, and a tartness intrinsic to the yeast.  Yeast is one of four inherent properties of beer and German Weizen yeasts are some of the most world renowned.   At just over 5% its a beer that's good to have as a friend.
results.malts: Pilsner Malt
results.name: German Wheat

results.description: Dark, rich and smoky…this classic porter is brewed with 63% German smoked malt and makes a perfect after dinner (or anytime) sipper for those who love a “bigger” beer. Winner of the Gold Medal in the 2004 Great American Beer Festival® for best Smoked Beer in America!
results.malts: 63% Bamberg Smoked Malt, Pale, Caramel 90L, Chocolate, Black-White Wheat
results.name: O'Fallon Smoked Porter

results.description: One of the coolest styles in the BJCP (Beer Judge Certification Program) as its development came out of American Homebrewing!  This is where our Brown comes from as well.  We keep this beer riding a line between chocolate bitterness and coffee roast and support it with American Hops as well.  Brown Beer is one of our favorite styles and has a lengthy history due to the fact that most malt kilning plants in ages past were using direct heat to roast and kiln.  It was a lot harder to keep malt light in color back in the day, but we've got most of it down to a science now.
results.name: American Brown
